### Tender Announcement:

#### **Title**
Small Appliance Repair – Dorchester Complex

#### **Reference**
cb-694-8354773

#### **Solicitation Description**
Notice of Intent to Award: Request for Proposal (RFP) - Small Appliance Repair

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract to a qualified vendor for the provision of small appliance repair services at the Dorchester Penitentiary Complex and Shepody Healing Center. The contract is scheduled to commence on March 8, 2024, and will remain in effect for approximately four and a half years, until March 31, 2028.

#### **Scope of Work**
The contractor will be responsible for providing regular maintenance and emergency repair services for various small appliances, including washers, dryers, refrigerators, freezers, stoves, ice machines, and water fountains, at the specified locations. The contractor must maintain an inventory of all tools brought on-site and allow CSC Security to verify these tools upon arrival and departure.

#### **Deliverables**
The contractor will be required to perform the following tasks:

* Provide on-site repair services for small appliances, including identification and recommendation of solutions for repair or replacement as necessary.
* Maintain the appliances in proper working order to ensure continuity of service.
* Respond to Dorchester Penitentiary Complex within one hour of receiving a service call to arrange a time to perform the repair or maintenance service.

#### **Trade Agreements**
This tender is open to all interested suppliers who are members of the following trade agreements: Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA).

#### **Language**
The tender documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).

#### **Contact Information**
Penny Panayiotopoullos, Contracting Officer
506-875-3649, penny.panayiotopoullos@csc-scc.gc.ca

N.B.: Interested suppliers can download the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada Buys/Tenders Opportunities website.
 
Note: The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
